title: King’s Last March

contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

As a belated tribute to Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, here is an encore presentation of our 2008 documentary, “King’s Last March.” Over 40 years after Dr. King’s assassination, he remains one of the most vivid symbols of hope for racial unity in America. But that’s not the way he was viewed in the last year of his life.

","type":"text/html"},{"type":"text/html","content":"
"}]
contentencoded: As a belated tribute to Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, here is an encore presentation of our 2008 documentary, “King’s Last March.” Over 40 years after Dr. King’s assassination, he remains one of the most vivid symbols of hope for racial unity in America. But that’s not the way he was viewed in the last year of his life.
